did.unittitle: "Weaving For Victory: Weaving Today the Pattern of Tomorrow" TWUA Radio Scripts
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection contains scripts from the TWUA radio program "Weaving For Victory" which ran from May 1943 through December 1943.

bioghist.p: The Textile Workers Union of America (TWUA) was an union for textile workers originally established through the Congress of Industrial Oranizations in 1939. In 1976 it merged with the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America and became the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union (ACTWU).

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: "Weaving For Victory: Weaving Today the Pattern of Tomorrow" TWUA Radio Scripts #6390. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Fred Muscheck's Report on the Program

scopecontent.p: To TWUA President Emil Rieve, August 12, 1943.
"Winding up the Program" Final broadcast of the series
Newspaper, September 1943, Doak Special Election Issue
Newspaper clipping, August 23, 1943. Cartoons highlighting the problems of workers on the home front
